name: Programming Massively Parallel Processors
desc: Programming Massively Parallel Processors: A Hands-on Approach shows both students and professionals alike the basic concepts of parallel programming and GPU architecture. Concise, intuitive, and practical, it is based on years of road-testing in the authors' own parallel computing courses
director: Wen-Mei W. Hwu, David B. Kirk, Izzat El Hajj

name: Elementary Statistics
desc: Simplifies statistics through practice and real-world applications Elementary Statistics: Picturing the World makes statistics approachable with stepped-out instruction, extensive real-life examples and exercises, and a design that fits content for each page to make the material more digestible. The text's combination of theory, pedagogy, and design helps students understand concepts and use statistics to describe and think about the world.

name: Ettinger's Textbook of Veterinary Internal Medicine
desc: Now Ettinger's trusted, all-in-one veterinary resource is even better! Trusted by small animal veterinarians for more than 50 years, Ettinger's Textbook of Veterinary Internal Medicine adds new content on the field's leading issues and trends to its unmatched, "gold standard" coverage of the diagnosis and treatment of medical problems of dogs and cats. Coverage begins with the basics of veterinary medicine, followed by sections on differential diagnosis for chief complaints and for clinicopathologic abnormalities, and continues with techniques, minimally invasive interventional therapies, critical care, toxicology, diseases by body system, and comorbidities.
director: Stephen J. Ettinger (Editor), Edward C. Feldman (Editor), Etienne Cote (Editor)

name: Art of Computer Programming, the, Volumes 1-4B, Boxed Set
desc: Countless readers have spoken about the profound personal influence of Knuth's work. Scientists have marveled at the beauty and elegance of his analysis, while ordinary programmers have successfully applied his "cookbook" solutions to their day-to-day problems. All have admired Knuth for the breadth, clarity, accuracy, and good humor found in his books.

name: Fourth Wing
desc: A #1 New York Times bestseller * Optioned for TV by Amazon Studios * Amazon Best Books of the Year, #4 * Apple Best Books of the Year 2023 * Barnes & Noble Best Fantasy Book of 2023 * NPR "Books We Love" 2023 * Audible Best Books of 2023 * Hudson Book of the Year * Google Play Best Books of 2023 * Indigo Best Books of 2023 * Waterstones Book of the Year finalist * Goodreads Choice Award, semi-finalist * Newsweek Staffers' Favorite Books of 2023 * Paste Magazine's Best Books of 2023.

name: The Housemaid Is Watching
desc: A twisting, pulse-pounding thriller from Freida McFadden, the New York Times bestselling author of The Housemaid and The Coworker.

name: The Silent Patient
desc: A psychological thriller about a woman who shoots her husband and then stops speaking, and the therapist determined to uncover her motive.

name: Where the Crawdads Sing
desc: A murder mystery and coming-of-age story set in the marshes of North Carolina, blending nature writing with a gripping narrative.

name: Educated
desc: A memoir about a woman who grew up in a survivalist family in Idaho and went on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.

name: The Midnight Library
desc: A novel about a library between life and death where each book represents a different life path the protagonist could have taken.

name: Project Hail Mary
desc: A lone astronaut must save the earth from disaster in this science fiction adventure by the author of *The Martian*.

name: Caste: The Origins of Our Discontents
desc: An exploration of America's unspoken caste system and its parallels to systems in India and Nazi Germany.

name: Klara and the Sun
desc: A dystopian novel about an AI companion who observes human behavior and questions what it means to love.

name: The Four Winds
desc: A historical novel about a woman's struggle to survive the Dust Bowl during the Great Depression.

name: Malibu Rising
desc: A novel about four famous siblings throwing an epic party in Malibu that ends in chaos.

name: The Push
desc: A psychological thriller about motherhood and the dark secrets passed down through generations.

name: The Sanatorium
desc: A detective investigating a murder at a remote Swiss hotel uncovers chilling secrets.

name: The Last Thing He Told Me
desc: A woman searches for the truth after her husband disappears, leaving behind a cryptic note.

name: Beautiful World, Where Are You
desc: A novel about friendship, love, and the search for meaning in modern life.

name: The Lincoln Highway
desc: A road trip novel set in 1950s America, following three young men on a journey across the country.

name: Apples Never Fall
desc: A family drama about the disappearance of a retired tennis coach and the secrets her children uncover.

name: The Paris Apartment
desc: A thriller about a woman who investigates her half-brother's disappearance in Paris.

name: Book Lovers
desc: A romantic comedy about a literary agent and an editor who clash professionally but spark personally.

name: Sea of Tranquility
desc: A time-travel novel spanning centuries, exploring art, pandemics, and human connection.

name: Greenlights
desc: Matthew McConaughey's unconventional memoir filled with raucous stories, outlaw wisdom, and lessons learned the hard way.

name: The Anthropocene Reviewed
desc: John Green reviews facets of the human-centered planet on a five-star scale in this deeply personal essay collection.

name: Crying in H Mart
desc: A memoir about grief, love, and identity through the lens of food and the author's Korean-American upbringing.

name: The Song of Achilles
desc: A retelling of the Iliad from Patroclus's perspective, exploring his relationship with Achilles.

name: Pachinko
desc: A multi-generational saga about a Korean family living in Japan, exploring identity and survival.

name: The House in the Cerulean Sea
desc: A whimsical fantasy about a caseworker who discovers magic and love at an orphanage for magical children.

name: Mexican Gothic
desc: A chilling horror novel about a woman investigating her cousin's claims of a haunted mansion in 1950s Mexico.

name: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue
desc: A woman makes a Faustian bargain to live forever but is cursed to be forgotten by everyone she meets.

name: Black Cake
desc: A family unravels secrets after their mother's death, tied to a Caribbean black cake recipe.

name: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
desc: A reclusive Hollywood icon reveals her scandalous life story to an unknown journalist.

name: Circe
desc: A reimagining of the life of Circe, the witch from Homer's Odyssey, as she discovers her power.

name: The Guest List
desc: A murder mystery set at a wedding on a remote Irish island, where everyone has a motive.

name: Normal People
desc: A nuanced love story about two Irish teenagers navigating class, intimacy, and identity.

name: The Vanishing Half
desc: Twin sisters choose to live in different racial worlds in this exploration of identity and family.

name: Such a Fun Age
desc: A witty novel about race, privilege, and the complexities of modern relationships.

name: The Thursday Murder Club
desc: A group of retirees solve cold cases in this charming and clever mystery.

name: Hamnet
desc: A fictional account of Shakespeare's son Hamnet and the inspiration behind *Hamlet*.

name: The Glass Hotel
desc: A haunting novel about greed, guilt, and the 2008 financial collapse.

name: Deacon King Kong
desc: A vibrant novel about a Brooklyn neighborhood in 1969 after a drunken deacon shoots a drug dealer.

name: Transcendent Kingdom
desc: A neuroscientist grapples with faith, addiction, and family trauma in this introspective novel.

name: The Once and Future Witches
desc: A historical fantasy about three sisters who rediscover magic in 1893 New Salem.

name: Piranesi
desc: A surreal novel about a man who lives in a labyrinthine house filled with statues and tidal mysteries.

name: The House of Broken Angels
desc: A Mexican-American family gathers for a funeral in this sprawling, humorous, and poignant novel.

name: The Water Dancer
desc: A young slave with a mysterious power joins the Underground Railroad in this magical realist novel.

name: The Nickel Boys
desc: A Pulitzer Prize-winning novel about two boys surviving a brutal reform school in Jim Crow Florida.

name: The Testaments
desc: The sequel to *The Handmaid's Tale*, revealing the fates of Gilead's women.

name: Daisy Jones & The Six
desc: An oral history of a fictional 1970s rock band's rise and fall, written like a documentary.

name: The Starless Sea
desc: A graduate student discovers a hidden library beneath New York in this lyrical fantasy.

name: The Dutch House
desc: A brother and sister reflect on their childhood in a lavish Pennsylvania mansion.

name: Red, White & Royal Blue
desc: A romantic comedy about the First Son of the U.S. falling for the Prince of Wales.

name: The Giver of Stars
desc: A historical novel about the Packhorse Librarians of Depression-era Kentucky.

name: The Institute
desc: A supernatural thriller about children with psychic abilities held captive in a sinister facility.

name: The Ten Thousand Doors of January
desc: A young girl discovers magical doors to other worlds in this lyrical adventure.

name: The Only Plane in the Sky
desc: An oral history of 9/11, compiled from hundreds of interviews with survivors and witnesses.

name: The Body
desc: A guide to human anatomy and health, blending science with Bill Bryson's signature wit.

name: Maybe You Should Talk to Someone
desc: A therapist shares insights from her own therapy sessions and her patients' journeys.

name: Talking to Strangers
desc: Malcolm Gladwell explores why interactions with strangers often go wrong, using psychology and case studies.

name: The Education of an Idealist
desc: Samantha Power's memoir about her journey from war correspondent to U.S. Ambassador to the UN.

name: The Moment of Lift
desc: Melinda Gates shares stories of women who inspired her philanthropic work on global gender equality.

name: The Right Stuff
desc: Tom Wolfe's classic account of the early U.S. space program and the Mercury astronauts.

name: The Sixth Extinction
desc: A Pulitzer Prize-winning exploration of mass extinctions and humanity's role in the current biodiversity crisis.

name: The Emperor of All Maladies
desc: A biography of cancer, blending history, science, and personal narratives.

name: The Warmth of Other Suns
desc: A sweeping history of the Great Migration of African Americans from the South to northern cities.

name: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
desc: The story of Henrietta Lacks, whose cancer cells were harvested without consent and revolutionized medicine.

name: The Power of Habit
desc: An exploration of how habits shape our lives and how they can be changed.

name: Quiet
desc: A groundbreaking book about introversion and how society undervalues quiet thinkers.

name: Thinking, Fast and Slow
desc: Nobel laureate Daniel Kahneman explains the two systems that drive human thought.

name: Deep Learning for Beginners
desc: An accessible introduction to deep learning concepts, neural networks, and AI applications. Includes hands-on exercises with Python.

name: Astrophysics for People in a Hurry
desc: Neil deGrasse Tyson breaks down the mysteries of the cosmos into bite-sized, digestible pieces for busy readers.

name: Becoming
desc: Michelle Obama's memoir chronicling her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House.

name: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
desc: Yuval Noah Harari explores the history of Homo sapiens from ancient ancestors to the technological advancements of today.

name: The Hobbit
desc: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an unexpected adventure with a group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home from the dragon Smaug.

name: Dune
desc: A science fiction epic about Paul Atreides, heir to a noble family entrusted with the dangerous desert planet Arrakis.

name: The Alchemist
desc: Santiago, a young Andalusian shepherd, dreams of finding worldly treasure and embarks on a journey that teaches him the true meaning of life.

name: The Girl on the Train
desc: Rachel Watson becomes entangled in a missing persons investigation after witnessing something shocking from her daily train commute.

name: The Martian
desc: Astronaut Mark Watney is stranded on Mars and must use his ingenuity to survive while NASA works to bring him home.

name: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
desc: Mark Manson challenges conventional self-help advice with a counterintuitive approach to living a good life.

name: The Night Circus
desc: Two young magicians, Celia and Marco, are bound in a magical competition within the enchanting Le Cirque des Rêves.

name: Born a Crime
desc: Trevor Noah's memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa, with a rebellious mother who defied the system.

name: The Book Thief
desc: Liesel Meminger steals books under Nazi Germany, sharing them with her neighbors and the Jewish man hidden in her basement.

name: The Handmaid's Tale
desc: In a dystopian future, Offred navigates life as a Handmaid in the oppressive Republic of Gilead.

name: The Da Vinci Code
desc: Robert Langdon and Sophie Neveu unravel clues hidden in Leonardo da Vinci's works to solve a murder and uncover a religious mystery.

name: The Road
desc: A father and son journey through a post-apocalyptic America, struggling to survive in a desolate world.

name: The Giver
desc: Jonas lives in a seemingly perfect society without pain or war—until he is chosen to receive dark truths from The Giver.

name: The Tipping Point
desc: Malcolm Gladwell examines how small actions can trigger massive social changes, epidemics, or trends.

name: The Name of the Wind
desc: Kvothe, a legendary wizard, recounts his life story—from childhood in a troupe to his time at a magical university.

name: The Happiness Project
desc: Gretchen Rubin spends a year test-driving wisdom from science and pop culture to improve her happiness.

name: The Goldfinch
desc: Theo Decker survives a terrorist attack at a museum, stealing a priceless painting that shapes his turbulent life.

name: The Kite Runner
desc: Amir seeks redemption for betraying his childhood friend Hassan in war-torn Afghanistan.

name: The Help
desc: In 1960s Mississippi, Skeeter collaborates with Black maids to write a tell-all book about their experiences.

name: The Fault in Our Stars
desc: Two teenagers with cancer, Hazel and Gus, fall in love while navigating life's fragility.

name: The War of Art
desc: Steven Pressfield identifies 'Resistance' as the enemy of creativity and offers strategies to overcome it.

name: The Devil in the White City
desc: Erik Larson intertwines the stories of architect Daniel Burnham and serial killer H.H. Holmes at the 1893 Chicago World's Fair.

name: The Stand
desc: After a pandemic wipes out most of humanity, survivors align with either good or evil in an apocalyptic showdown.

name: The Silent Spring
desc: Rachel Carson's groundbreaking exposé on the environmental damage caused by pesticides like DDT.

name: The Road Less Traveled
desc: M. Scott Peck explores love, spiritual growth, and discipline as paths to a fulfilling life.

name: The Hunger Games
desc: Katniss Everdeen volunteers for a deadly televised competition where children fight to the death in a dystopian future.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
desc: Holden Caulfield recounts his days wandering New York City after being expelled from prep school.

name: The Sun Also Rises
desc: Jake Barnes and his disillusioned expatriate friends travel from Paris to Pamplona in post-WWI Europe.

name: The God Delusion
desc: Richard Dawkins argues against the existence of God and critiques religion's influence on society.

name: Empire of Pain
desc: Patrick Radden Keefe investigates the Sackler dynasty and their role in the opioid crisis.

name: Detransition, Baby
desc: A transgender woman, her detransitioned ex, and his lover navigate unconventional parenthood.

name: How to Avoid a Climate Disaster
desc: Bill Gates outlines practical solutions to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and prevent environmental collapse.

name: The Code Breaker
desc: Walter Isaacson’s biography of Jennifer Doudna, the Nobel-winning scientist behind CRISPR gene editing.

name: Cloud Cuckoo Land
desc: Five characters across time—from ancient Constantinople to a futuristic spaceship—are linked by an ancient text.

name: The Maidens
desc: A therapist investigates a secret society at Cambridge University after a student’s murder.

name: Harlem Shuffle
desc: A furniture salesman gets entangled in heists and Harlem’s criminal underworld in the 1960s.

name: The Sentence
desc: A haunted bookstore employee grapples with ghosts—literal and metaphorical—during the 2020 pandemic.

name: No One Is Talking About This
desc: A woman famous for her viral internet posts confronts real-life tragedy in this experimental novel.

name: The Love Songs of W.E.B. Du Bois
desc: An epic chronicle of a Black family’s lineage from slavery to modern-day Georgia.

name: The Paper Palace
desc: A woman’s affair forces her to choose between her husband and her childhood love during a Cape Cod summer.

name: Matrix
desc: A rebellious nun becomes a powerful abbess in 12th-century England, defying patriarchal norms.

name: The Final Revival of Opal & Nev
desc: An oral history of a fictional 1970s rock duo’s rise, fall, and controversial reunion.

name: The Plot
desc: A struggling writer steals a dead student’s story idea, only to face blackmail when it becomes a bestseller.

name: Great Circle
desc: A female aviator’s disappearance in 1950 parallels a modern-day actress portraying her in a film.

name: The Prophets
desc: Two enslaved men in the antebellum South find love amid brutality in this lyrical debut.

name: The Paris Library
desc: A WWII librarian at the American Library in Paris risks her life to save books from the Nazis.

name: The Rose Code
desc: Three female codebreakers at Bletchley Park reunite to solve a wartime mystery.

name: The Survivors
desc: A man returns to his coastal hometown and confronts a tragedy tied to a decades-old shipwreck.

name: The Lost Apothecary
desc: A historian uncovers secrets of a 18th-century female apothecary who sold poisons to women.

name: The Kitchen Front
desc: Four women compete in a WWII cooking contest to transform their lives and defy societal norms.

name: The Windsor Knot
desc: Queen Elizabeth II secretly solves a murder at Windsor Castle in this cozy mystery.

name: The Last Bookshop in London
desc: A woman finds solace in a London bookshop during the Blitz, sharing stories to uplift her community.

name: The Arctic Fury
desc: A female explorer leads a team of women into the Arctic, facing danger and betrayal.

name: The Venice Sketchbook
desc: A woman uncovers her great-aunt’s secrets in WWII Venice through a sketchbook and a love story.

name: The Girl with the Louding Voice
desc: A Nigerian girl escapes forced marriage and fights for education and independence.

name: The Book of Lost Names
desc: A WWII forger helps Jewish children escape Nazi-occupied France, leaving clues in an ancient manuscript.

name: The Secret Keeper of Jaipur
desc: A sequel to *The Henna Artist*, following Lakshmi’s protégé into 1960s Jaipur’s high society and scandals.

name: The Personal Librarian
desc: Belle da Costa Greene, J.P. Morgan’s Black librarian, hides her racial identity in Gilded Age New York.

name: The Woman with the Blue Star
desc: A Jewish girl hiding in the Kraków sewers befriends a Polish girl aboveground during WWII.

name: The Sweetness of Water
desc: Two freed Black brothers and a grieving white couple form an unlikely bond in post-Civil War Georgia.

name: The Lying Life of Adults
desc: A teenage girl in Naples navigates family lies, class divides, and sexual awakening in this coming-of-age novel.

name: The Mirror & the Light
desc: The final installment of Hilary Mantel’s trilogy follows Thomas Cromwell’s rise and fall in Henry VIII’s court.

name: The Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes
desc: A prequel to *The Hunger Games* exploring young Coriolanus Snow’s role as a mentor in the 10th Games.

name: Shuggie Bain
desc: A boy growing up in 1980s Glasgow cares for his alcoholic mother in this Booker Prize-winning novel.

name: The House of Whispers
desc: A gothic thriller set in a crumbling Venetian palazzo, where a woman uncovers family secrets tied to witchcraft.

name: The Silence
desc: When a mysterious sound turns people into violent killers, a family fights for survival in a world gone silent.

name: The Book of Two Ways
desc: A death doula survives a plane crash and reexamines her life, torn between two love stories.

name: The Devil and the Dark Water
desc: A detective and a disgraced investigator solve a supernatural mystery aboard a haunted 17th-century ship.

name: The Kingdom
desc: Two brothers inherit a sinister theme park in this Nordic noir thriller blending family drama and crime.

name: The Cold Millions
desc: Two brothers join the labor movement in 1909 Spokane, facing violence and betrayal.

name: The Pull of the Stars
desc: A nurse tends to pregnant patients during the 1918 flu pandemic in Dublin.

name: The Bright Lands
desc: A man returns to his Texas hometown to investigate his brother’s disappearance, uncovering dark secrets in a football-obsessed community.

name: The End of October
desc: A virologist races to stop a deadly pandemic in this eerily prescient thriller.

name: The Girl from Widow Hills
desc: A woman who survived a childhood disappearance faces new danger when her past resurfaces.

name: The Shadows
desc: A man returns to his hometown to confront a childhood friend who believed in lucid dreaming—and murder.

name: The Order
desc: A Harvard professor uncovers a Vatican conspiracy involving a secret gospel and the death of the Pope.

name: The Resisters
desc: In a dystopian future, a Black family fights against an AI-ruled society that bans their daughter from playing baseball.

name: The Night Watchman
desc: Based on the life of Louise Erdrich’s grandfather, a Chippewa councilman fights Congress’s termination of Native rights in 1953.

name: The Mountains Sing
desc: A multigenerational saga of a Vietnamese family surviving war, colonization, and the Communist regime.

name: The Eighth Detective
desc: An editor investigates a reclusive author’s collection of murder mysteries, uncovering hidden clues.

name: The Death of Vivek Oji
desc: A Nigerian family grapples with the mysterious death of their gender-nonconforming son.

name: The Only Good Indians
desc: Four Blackfoot men are haunted by a vengeful entity after a traumatic elk hunt years earlier.

name: The Children of Red Peak
desc: Survivors of a cult’s apocalyptic massacre reunite to confront their past—and the entity they summoned.

name: The Return
desc: A journalist investigates her father’s disappearance during the Libyan revolution.

name: The Book of Longings
desc: A fictional account of Ana, the wife of Jesus, who pursues her own spiritual and intellectual passions.

name: The Henna Artist
desc: In 1950s Jaipur, a henna artist builds a life of independence while hiding her scandalous past.

name: The Jane Austen Society
desc: In post-WWII England, a group of villagers bond over their love of Austen’s novels to save her legacy.

name: The Lions of Fifth Avenue
desc: A librarian in 1913 New York investigates rare book thefts at the NYPL, while her granddaughter faces a similar mystery in 1993.

name: The Butterfly Lampshade
desc: A woman recalls fragmented memories of her mother’s mental illness and a haunting childhood incident.

name: The Southern Book Club's Guide to Slaying Vampires
desc: A 1990s book club fights a charming stranger who may be a bloodsucking monster.

name: The Girl with the Dragon Heart
desc: A chocolatier’s apprentice teams up with a dragon-turned-girl to save their city from spies.

name: The Black Kids
desc: A wealthy Black teen navigates race, class, and family during the 1992 LA riots.

name: The Fixed Stars
desc: A memoir of a woman’s late-in-life realization of her queer identity and the dissolution of her marriage.

name: The Lightness
desc: A teenage girl joins a group of girls at a Buddhist retreat to learn levitation—and confronts dark secrets.

name: The Herd
desc: Two sisters clash when one joins a women-only coworking space with cult-like undertones.

name: The Unspoken Name
desc: A priestess destined for sacrifice escapes to become an assassin for a wizard in this fantasy epic.

name: The Mercies
desc: In 17th-century Norway, women accused of witchcraft face persecution after a storm kills their men.

name: The Splendid and the Vile
desc: Erik Larson chronicles Winston Churchill’s leadership during the Blitz, blending history and personal drama.

name: The Yellow Bird Sings
desc: A Jewish mother and her mute daughter hide from Nazis in a Polish barn, where music becomes their escape.

name: The Library of Lost and Found
desc: A librarian discovers a mysterious book of fairy tales with connections to her past, unraveling family secrets.

name: Recursion
desc: A neuroscientist and a detective race to stop a terrifying new technology that destroys memories—and reality itself.

name: The Turn of the Key
desc: A nanny takes a job at a smart home in the Scottish Highlands, only to be accused of murder when a child dies.

name: The Whisper Man
desc: A father and son move to a new town, only to discover it's haunted by a serial killer who whispers to children.

name: The Book Woman of Troublesome Creek
desc: A blue-skinned woman delivers books on horseback in 1930s Kentucky, facing prejudice and hardship.

name: The Secret Commonwealth
desc: Lyra Belacqua, now 20, embarks on a dangerous journey across Europe in this sequel to the His Dark Materials trilogy.

name: The Wives
desc: A woman discovers her husband has two other wives—and one of them may be missing.

name: The Guardians
desc: A lawyer and her team work to exonerate a man convicted of murder in this legal thriller.

name: The Other's Gold
desc: Four college friends navigate adulthood while hiding dark secrets from their past.

name: The Need
desc: A paleobotanist begins seeing an intruder in her home—who may or may not be real—in this psychological thriller.

name: The Lager Queen of Minnesota
desc: Two sisters feud over their inheritance and find success in the beer industry decades apart.

name: The Escape Room
desc: Four Wall Street coworkers enter an elevator for a team-building exercise—but it's actually a deadly game.

name: The Chain
desc: A mother must kidnap another child to save her own daughter in this terrifying thriller.

name: The Bride Test
desc: A Vietnamese-American man's mother brings a potential bride from Vietnam, sparking an unexpected romance.

name: The Bookish Life of Nina Hill
desc: A introverted bookstore employee's life is upended when she discovers a family she never knew existed.

name: The Stationery Shop
desc: A love story set against the 1953 Iranian coup, where a couple is separated by politics and time.

name: The Floating Feldmans
desc: A dysfunctional family reunites for a cruise, forcing them to confront old wounds and secrets.

name: The Last House Guest
desc: A summer guest dies under mysterious circumstances, and her best friend becomes the prime suspect.

name: The Book Charmer
desc: A small-town librarian believes books have a magical way of finding the right readers at the right time.

name: The Last Time I Saw You
desc: A woman investigates her mother's mysterious death decades earlier after reconnecting with her childhood best friend.

name: The Printed Letter Bookshop
desc: A lawyer inherits a struggling bookstore and discovers the power of books to heal and connect.

name: The Book Supremacy
desc: A rare book dealer gets entangled in espionage when a signed Ian Fleming novel becomes a target for thieves.

name: The Book of Lost Friends
desc: A teacher uncovers the story of three women who journeyed across the post-Civil War South to find their lost families.

name: The Book of Hidden Wonders
desc: A young girl's illustrations in her father's books contain hidden clues to a family secret.

name: The Lighthouse Witches
desc: Two sisters are drawn to a mysterious Scottish lighthouse where women have vanished for centuries, uncovering a dark witchcraft legacy.

name: The Cartographers
desc: A young map curator discovers a mysterious hidden map in her deceased father's belongings, leading to a dangerous treasure hunt through NYC's secret cartographic history.

name: Notes on an Execution
desc: A death row inmate's final hours are recounted through the perspectives of the women whose lives he destroyed, challenging notions of true crime fascination.

name: The Violin Conspiracy
desc: A Black classical violinist's stolen Stradivarius becomes the center of a racial and legal battle in this debut about art, heritage, and ambition.

name: How High We Go in the Dark
desc: A plague unleashed from melting Arctic permafrost connects intergenerational stories of love and loss in this genre-bending speculative novel.

name: The Maid
desc: A neurodivergent hotel maid becomes the prime suspect in a wealthy guest's murder, forcing her to prove her innocence.

name: The Candy House
desc: A tech genius invents a device that allows users to access all their memories—and others'—in this kaleidoscopic novel about privacy and connection.

name: Young Mungo
desc: A Protestant boy and Catholic boy fall in love in 1990s Glasgow, navigating sectarian violence and family dysfunction.

name: Fiona and Jane
desc: Two Taiwanese-American best friends navigate adulthood across Los Angeles and New York in this intimate story of friendship and identity.

name: The School for Good Mothers
desc: A single mother is sent to a government-run reform school for parental failures in this dystopian take on motherhood and surveillance.

name: The Kaiju Preservation Society
desc: A laid-off tech worker joins a secret organization caring for Godzilla-like creatures in an alternate dimension in this comedic sci-fi adventure.

name: This Time Tomorrow
desc: A woman wakes up as her 16-year-old self on her 40th birthday, given a chance to alter her past and her dying father's fate.

name: The Diamond Eye
desc: Based on the true story of a Ukrainian librarian who became WWII's deadliest female sniper before touring America as a propaganda tool.

name: The Measure
desc: Every adult receives a box revealing how long they'll live, forcing humanity to grapple with fate and free will.

name: The Last White Man
desc: One morning, a man wakes up to find his skin has darkened, sparking a surreal transformation across his community.

name: The Cloisters
desc: A grad student working at NYC's medieval museum uncovers a deck of tarot cards that may predict deaths—including her own.

name: The Last Party
desc: At a New Year's Eve party in a Welsh resort, a washed-up singer is found dead, and a detective must solve the case before midnight.

name: The Half Life of Valery K
desc: A nuclear scientist in a 1950s Soviet labor camp is forced to study radiation effects in a contaminated city.

name: The Family Remains
desc: A suitcase of human bones connects to a decades-old crime in this sequel to *The Family Upstairs*, revealing new twists about the Lamb siblings.

name: The It Girl
desc: A woman obsessed with her college roommate's murder confronts the man she helped convict when new evidence suggests he may be innocent.

name: The Daughter of Doctor Moreau
desc: A reimagining of the classic novel set in 19th-century Mexico, following the sheltered daughter of a scientist creating hybrid creatures.

name: The Last to Vanish
desc: A journalist investigates a string of disappearances in a creepy Appalachian tourist town where visitors keep vanishing.

name: The Last Dreamwalker
desc: A woman inherits her family's Gullah-Geechee ability to enter others' dreams—and must stop a cousin using the power for evil.

name: The Fortunes of Jaded Women
desc: A Vietnamese-American family cursed to never find love gets a prophecy that could break the spell—if three generations of women can stop feuding.

name: The Marsh Queen
desc: A Washington DC bird artist returns to her Florida swamp hometown to uncover the truth about her father's alleged suicide.

name: The House of Fortune
desc: In 1705 Amsterdam, a merchant's daughter falls for a theater set painter, risking her family's fortune in this sequel to *The Miniaturist*.

name: The Last Chairlift
desc: A writer investigates his mother's past as a ski instructor and her relationship with a ghost in this sprawling generational saga.

name: The Night Ship
